intro: Harmogia ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf harmogia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it prefers a humid climate.
